title: REVIEW  ---  Play:  News Quiz  ----  By Daniel Akst
text:
1. President-elect Joe Biden will nominate Samantha Power to lead USAID. For which book did she win the Pulitzer Prize?

A. "The Bottom Billion"

B. "The Age of Innocence"

C. "The Elusive Quest for Growth"

D. "A Problem from Hell"

---

2. Sued by the Justice Dept., Visa abandoned its planned acquisition of which fintech firm?

A. Herringbone

B. Paisley

C. Plaid

D. Tattersall

---

3. In Uganda, aging strongman Yoweri Museveni faced an electoral challenge from rapper Bobi Wine -- who campaigned wearing what?

A. A bulletproof vest

B. A Bob Marley T-shirt

C. A Ugandan flag

D. A fedora

---

4. Clutter expert Jes Marcy offered tips on de-hoarding. How should you begin?

A. Make a nice stiff drink.

B. Close your eyes and deal with the first thing you touch.

C. Start with the garage.

D. Pick a room and work high to low.

---

5. The House voted -- again -- to impeach President Trump. A poll found that 52% of Americans support removal. What share of Republicans agree?

A. None

B. 10%

C. 20%

D. 40%

---

6. James Simons, perhaps the greatest money manager ever, stepped down as chairman of his firm. Name it.

A. Renaissance Technologies

B. Franklin Simon

C. Simon & Schuster

D. Point72

---

7. Uncle Sam is urging states to give Covid vaccines -- to which new group?

A. 73-year-old left-handers born during a full moon

B. Anyone over 65 and people with medical conditions

C. Civil servants in essential roles such as bus drivers

D. Members of the armed forces

---

8. Australian lobsters -- who knew, right? -- were in the news. Why?

A. A study found that therapy can get them out of their shells.

B. A fishing-rights dispute with New Zealand boiled over.

C. China blocked imports, sending prices plummeting.

D. Global warming has made them scarce.

---

ANSWERS

1. D

2. C

3. A

4. B

5. B

6. A

7. B

8. C
